346. Brewster, Margaret Sutherland (Mrs. H.F.)
1915. Brewster, Mrs. Margaret S., Birch Hills, Sask.

SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 1

PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to the Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask., where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our province.

Address: Birch Hills, Sask.

Birthplace: London, England

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Eastern Canada? 1915

Where did you set up housekeeping? Birch Hills, Sask.

Where had you been living before that? London, England

For how many people did you prepare meals? 4

How far was it to your nearest store? Birch Hills, Sask.

How often would a visit be made to the store? Every two weeks

What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? Wheat flour

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Canadian Wheat Board (C.W.B.)

In what quantities did you buy it? 10 lbs. at a time

What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $3.30

How much did you use graham flour? 10 lbs.

Whole wheat flour? 10 lbs.

Was flour milled locally? No

How far away? Birch Hills, Sask.

What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 80¢

What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal, R. L. Wheat

Other? None

Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Yes

How did you grind it? In the flour mill

16. WRAPPINGS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappings and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

Packaged articles were not so common.
Wax paper not used.

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner and supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

1900a
Breakfast - oatmeal or cracked wheat porridge,
fried bacon, potatoes, toast, tea.
Dinner - meat, potatoes, vegetable, pudding
Supper - Potatoes or pancakes, fruit and
plain cake or cookies (no icing)
Father (mother), self aged 7, brother aged 2

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Western Canada? 1904
Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at the time.

Turkey, potatoes, mashed turnips, pickles
and cranberry jelly. Xmas plum pudding
mince tarts.
Father (34) mother (34) self (9) brother (2)
one other friend (maybe 23) old neighbor (60 or 70)

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

No.
